answers.answer: He should have a complete workup from the doctor to see why he is craving sugar so much.  Has he ever been tested for diabetes?  The doctor should also talk to him about healthy diet issues, he might listen to a doctor.  Sugar *is* addictive, especially if someone has other issues happening (i.e., depression for example), but first you want to rule out a physical reason (illness or condition) for this craving.

I agree with Annie,  this could be caused by either physical or emotional issues.Since you know his cholesterol number,  it sounds like you've had some medical testing done on him.Children with emotional issues - children in foster care,  or in juvenile detention facilities for example - have a very high rate of sugar cravings.  They will often add sugar to soft drinks,  or even eat spoonfuls of sugar straight.Does he seem emotionally distressed?I agree that he needs a medical workup and an appointment with a good children's therapist.Best wishes.
